result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven R Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

Attend, pay for, and succ. complete any educational programs or treatment ordered by agent. 

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.

Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before leaving the courthouse today.  

May sign up for probation on Thursday, October 22, 2015.

2 days credit in the event of revocation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven R Smith in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  2 cases - 14CF101 and 15CF11, plea and sentencing in both.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution.  State moves to amend all three counts in these two cases to misdemeanors.  Court allows the amendments.  Def pleads guilty to the charges as amended.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Atty. M asks for 1 set of costs.

Court withholds sentence for 20 months probation.  Conditions:  Attend, pay for, and succ. complete any educational programs or treatment ordered by agent.  Pay 1 set of costs (1 set for the 2 cases).  Submit DNA sample at the RCSD before leaving the courthouse today.  May sign up tomorrow (Thur) for probation.  In the event of revocation, def entitled to 2 days credit in 14CF101.

Defendant Steven R Smith in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA states that def has met conditions of offer; asks for plea/sentencing date.  Oct. 21 at 2:30 for plea/sentencing in both 14CF101 and 15CF11.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
request of SPD to move the next hearing in this case to 9/22

Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court with Defendant Steven R Smith. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Further status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

15CF11/Status and 14CF101/Status.  Defendant Steven R Smith in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA requests reset of both.  July 22 at 9.  ATN needed in 15CF11.  Court directs def to stop at RCSD before he leaves for booking process.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Steven R Smith in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  2 cases called together:  14CF101/status and 15CF11/initial.

15CF11 - Atty. M waives formal reading of the complaint.  Court states charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  Court informs def of rights including right to prelim.  Atty. M waives prelim time limits; asks for status scheduling of both cases in late April or early May.  Court accepts def's waiver of 20-day rule.  May 27th is first date that works for all parties.  Both cases set for that date at 9.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Steven R Smith in court with attorney Lisa A. McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. M waives formal reading and time for prelim; asks for March scheduling and revisit of bail.  Court states charge and informs def of the possible max. penalties.  No change in bail.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
